Package com.atgenomix.seqslab.piper.plugin.api.loader

Interface Loader

All Superinterfaces:
Closable, Operator, OperatorPipelineV3, Serializable, org.apache.spark.sql.api.java.UDF0<org.apache.spark.sql.Dataset<org.apache.spark.sql.Row>>
All Known Subinterfaces:
SupportsCopyToLocal, SupportsHadoopDFS, SupportsPartitioning, SupportsReadingDataFrame, SupportsReadingDeltaTable
@DeveloperApi public interface Loader extends Operator, org.apache.spark.sql.api.java.UDF0<org.apache.spark.sql.Dataset<org.apache.spark.sql.Row>>
An operator object responsible for loading (reading) an in-memory DataFrame or copying to local host file system from a specific data source, e.g. blob storage. A Loader is a user-defined function (UDF) that takes no parameter and returns a Spark DataFrame if any. Each Loader object is created first by invoking Loader operator factory (implements LoaderSupport) when pipeline task requests it and will be lazily initialized when it is ready to run. When completed, the close method will be invoked to release resources. SeqsLab workflow engine supports multiple data processing features to control and optimize workloads. An operator can inform SeqsLab workflow engine its supporting features by implementing the specific feature interfaces. For instance, a loader implementing SupportsCopyToLocal will download, e.g. genome reference files, to all available computing node; the loader can additionally implement SupportsPartitioning to tell workflow engine it is partition-aware and will download each data partition. The workflow engine will run the loader in parallel and ensure the same data partition across multiple input data sources must be in the same Spark executor in localization process.
See Also:

  • SupportsHadoopDFS
  • SupportsPartitioning
  • SupportsReadingDataFrame
  • SupportsReadingDeltaTable
